name: Polarity Forms
description: Display customized forms to users for gathering user feedback or input.

options.name: Form Delivery Method
options.description: Choose how form data should be delivered.  The default is "Email".

default.display: Email - form data will be sent to the configured email address (SMTP settings must be configured)

options.display: Email - form data will be sent to the configured email address (SMTP settings must be configured)
Log File - form data will be logged as JSON in the integration log file
Email and Log File - form data will be sent via email and logged (SMTP settings must be configured)

options.name: SMTP User
options.description: Your SMTP username.  Leave blank for unauthenticated SMTP servers.

options.name: SMTP Server Password
options.description: Your SMTP password. Leave blank for unauthenticated SMTP servers.

options.name: SMTP Connection Security
options.description: The type of connection security to use when connecting to the SMTP server.

default.display: Default (STARTTLS used if supported by the SMTP Server)

options.display: Default (STARTTLS used if supported by the SMTP Server)

options.name: Sender Email Address
options.description: The sender email address for all emails sent by the integration.  If left blank, the submitting Polarity user's email address will be used.

options.name: Default Recipient Email Address
options.description: The default email address to send form submissions to if a form configuration does not specify a recipient.

options.name: Default CC Email Address
options.description: The default email address to CC form submissions to if a form configuration does not specify a CC.  If left blank, no CC will be sent.

options.name: Enabled Forms
options.description: A comma delimited list of forms that should be available when interacting with this integration.  Forms should be referred to by their filename (not including the `.json` file extension).

options.name: Include Integration Names and Summary Tags
options.description: If checked, the email will include the name of integrations the user had access to when submitting the form as well as summary tags.

options.name: Show Forms By Default
options.description: If checked, the integration will show the forms by default.  If unchecked, the user will need to click to expand and view the forms.
